para.text: The Mayor shall make the Program available to eligible individuals by January 1, 2010.
To meet the deadline set forth in subsection (a) of this section, the Mayor is authorized to enter into a contract with one or more health insurers to administer the Program.
Any contract entered into pursuant to this section shall require annual reporting of clinical-quality measurements and utilization data to the Mayor.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 18-104, in subsec. (a), substituted “January 1, 2010” for “July 1, 2009”.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
annoGroup.annotation: Section 3(c) of D.C. Law 18-134, in subsec. (a), substituted “January 1,2010” for “July 1, 2009”.
Section 6(b) of D.C. Law 18-134 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
Section 2(d) of D.C. Law 18-270 added subsec. (d) to read as follows: “(d) The Mayor is authorized to provide premium subsidies to qualified eligible individuals.”.
Section 4(b) of D.C. Law 18-270 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
